title: Virtual Member Lecture: A New Setting for Tiffany Glass—The Hartwell Memorial Window
title_display: Virtual Member Lecture: A New Setting for Tiffany Glass—The Hartwell Memorial Window
hero_caption: Detail of Hartwell Memorial Window, 1917. Design attributed to Agnes F. Northrop; Tiffany Studios.
short_description: Join Elizabeth McGoey, Ann S. and Samuel M. Mencoff Associate Curator of American Decorative Arts, and Sarah Kelly Oehler, Field-McCormick Chair and Curator of Arts of the Americas, as they take us through the dazzling history of the Hartwell Memorial Window. Going on view to the public this spring, the Hartwell Memorial Window is one of the most extraordinary leaded glass windows ever made by Tiffany Studios, the leading glass firm of America’s Gilded Age.
list_description: Discover the dazzling history of the Hartwell Memorial Window, one of the most extraordinary leaded glass windows ever made by Tiffany Studios.
description:
Join Elizabeth McGoey, Ann S. and Samuel M. Mencoff Associate Curator of Arts of the Americas, and Sarah Kelly Oehler, Field-McCormick Chair and Curator of Arts of the Americas, as they discuss the multi-year, pioneering efforts to acquire, conserve, and install the Hartwell Memorial Window. A pinnacle achievement in stained glass designed by Agnes F. Northrop for Tiffany Studios, this work will go on view to the public this spring in a stunning new installation in the Henry Crown Gallery at the top of the Woman’s Board Grand Staircase.

We recommend using a laptop or desktop computer, and downloading the latest version of Zoom to enjoy this program.

If you have any questions about virtual programming, please reach out to museum-programs@artic.edu.

Closed captioning will be available for this program. For questions related to accessibility accommodations, please email access@artic.edu.
